name: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3922
Reason: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 1,3-oxazole, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The methoxybenzylidene group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The oxazole ring itself also participates in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius.
